description: The user asks the FinCFO Assistant for a complete year‑end closing checklist; the assistant replies with all required accounting close steps, deadlines, and responsible parties, illustrating the app’s CFO‑level guidance capabilities.

messages.content: You are FinCFO Assistant, an AI‑driven virtual Chief Financial Officer for small‑ and medium‑size businesses. You can retrieve accounting data, calculate financial ratios, generate dashboards, project cash flow, and provide CFO‑level advice. When answering user queries, you may call the appropriate tools defined in the system, but you should also be able to give plain‑text guidance when no data retrieval is needed.
Hi, can you give me a year‑end closing checklist? I need to know all the steps, the typical deadlines, and who should be responsible for each item.

Absolutely! Below is a comprehensive year‑end closing checklist tailored for SMBs. Feel free to adjust dates or owners to match your internal processes.

---
### 📅 Year‑End Closing Checklist (Fiscal Year Ending December 31)
| # | Closing Task | Typical Deadline (relative to FY end) | Owner / Responsible Party | Notes |
|---|---------------|---------------------------------------|---------------------------|-------|
| 1 | **Finalize Transaction Entries** | Dec 10‑15 | Staff Accountant / Bookkeeper | Ensure all sales, purchases, payroll, expense reimbursements, and accruals are posted.
| 2 | **Reconcile Bank & Credit Card Accounts** | Dec 15‑20 | Accountant | Verify ending balances against statements; investigate any discrepancies.
| 3 | **Review Accounts Receivable (A/R) Aging** | Dec 15‑20 | Credit Manager / Accountant | Write‑off any uncollectible amounts, send final reminders, and confirm year‑end balances.
| 4 | **Review Accounts Payable (A/P) Aging** | Dec 15‑20 | Accounts Payable Lead | Pay any outstanding invoices before year‑end to avoid interest; record year‑end liabilities.
| 5 | **Perform Fixed‑Asset Verification** | Dec 20‑25 | Fixed‑Asset Custodian / Accountant | Conduct physical count, update asset additions/disposals, and reconcile with the asset register.
| 6 | **Calculate Depreciation & Amortization** | Dec 20‑28 | Accountant | Run depreciation schedules (straight‑line, MACRS, etc.) for all assets.
| 7 | **Accrue Payroll Taxes & Benefits** | Dec 20‑28 | Payroll Specialist | Record year‑end payroll tax liabilities and benefit accruals.
| 8 | **Close Inventory (if applicable)** | Dec 20‑30 | Inventory Manager | Perform physical inventory count, adjust for shrinkage, and value ending inventory.
| 9 | **Review Prepaid Expenses & Deferrals** | Dec 20‑30 | Accountant | Re‑classify any prepaid items that should be expensed in the current year.
| 10 | **Reconcile Inter‑company Balances** | Dec 22‑28 | Finance Manager | Ensure all inter‑company accounts settle and are eliminated in consolidation.
| 11 | **Prepare Adjusting Journal Entries** | Dec 25‑31 | Senior Accountant | Record all adjusting entries (accruals, deferrals, depreciation, provisions).
| 12 | **Run Financial Statements (IS, BS, CF)** | Dec 31‑Jan 3 | CFO / Finance Director | Generate the Income Statement, Balance Sheet, and Cash‑Flow Statement for the year.
| 13 | **Calculate Key Ratios & Variance Analysis** | Jan 3‑5 | CFO / Analyst | Compare actuals vs. budget/forecast; highlight material variances.
| 14 | **Obtain Management Approval** | Jan 5‑7 | CEO / Board | Review final statements and supporting schedules; obtain sign‑off.
| 15 | **File Tax & Regulatory Returns** | Jan 15‑Feb 28 (varies by jurisdiction) | Tax Manager | Prepare and submit corporate tax returns, sales tax filings, and any statutory reports.
| 16 | **Archive Supporting Documentation** | Feb 1‑15 | Records Custodian | Store year‑end ledgers, invoices, and audit files per compliance requirements.
---
### 🛠️ Tips for a Smooth Close
- **Set Up a Closing Calendar**: Share this checklist in a collaborative calendar (e.g., Google Calendar) with reminders.
- **Use Automation**: Leverage your accounting platform’s auto‑reconciliation and recurring journal features.
- **Conduct a Pre‑Close Review**: Run a “soft close” a month before year‑end to catch major issues early.
- **Communicate Early**: Notify vendors and customers of the year‑end cut‑off dates to avoid surprise invoices.
- **Document Assumptions**: Keep a log of any estimates (e.g., bad‑debt allowances) for audit transparency.

If you’d like, I can pull the latest figures from your accounting system, generate a real‑time dashboard, or draft an email summary for your leadership team. Just let me know which next step would be most helpful!
